org.cougaar.core.plugin
Class ServletPlugin

java.lang.Object
  org.cougaar.util.GenericStateModelAdapter
      org.cougaar.core.blackboard.BlackboardClientComponent
          org.cougaar.core.plugin.ComponentPlugin
              org.cougaar.core.plugin.ParameterizedPlugin
                  org.cougaar.core.plugin.AnnotatedSubscriptionsPlugin
                      org.cougaar.core.plugin.ServletPlugin
All Implemented Interfaces:
BlackboardClient, Component, SubscriptionLifeCycle, PluginBase, GenericStateModel
public abstract class ServletPlugin
extends AnnotatedSubscriptionsPlugin

This plugin is a base class for servlets that either modify or subscribe to the blackboard.

If a servlet only requires blackboard queries and no subscriptions or add/change/remove modifications, then ComponentServlet is recommended.

If isTransactional() is true then all servlet processing work is done single-threaded in the "execute()" method, where it can access subscriptions and modify the blackboard using the standard "blackboard.publish*" methods.

Constructor Detail

ServletPlugin

Method Detail

isTransactional

protected boolean isTransactional()
Return true (the default) if all servlet requests should run single-threaded in the "execute()" method, otherwise false if they should run in the servlet engine's threads (and possibly in parallel with other servlet requests and the "execute()" thread).

If a servlet requires a cross-transaction result, e.g.:

  1. publishAdd object X
  2. wait another plugin to react to object X, e.g. via a "notify()" callback or published response
  3. finish the servlet call
then "isTransactional()" must return false.

Also, if a servlet has no subscriptions or private state, then it's slightly more efficient to have this method return false. This will allow requests to run in parallel.

In all other cases, this method should return true. This allows the "doGet(...)" method to access subscriptions and other internal state without a synchronization lock, since the "execute()" method is always single-threaded and runs in a blackboard transaction.

getPath

protected java.lang.String getPath()
Get the path for the Servlet's registration.

Typically the path is supplied by a "path=" plugin argument, but a subclass can hard-code the path by overriding this method.

createServlet

protected javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet createServlet()
Create our servlet, which by default calls our doGet/doPost/doPost methods.

A subclass can override this method if it's designed to create a separate servlet. However, if isTransactional() is true then it should use serviceLater(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse) to do all blackboard work in the "execute()" method instead of the servlet callback thread.

Even though we switch to the "execute()" thread, we must still block the servlet callback until we finish the work, otherwise the servlet engine will close our response stream.
